Reviews.Title: “Hotel Colors: 'Okay'ish experience”
Reviews.Author: CPJAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in the first week of April 2012. I was more a like an partment converted to hotel rooms. Finding the hotel is a little difficult as they haven't kept any name-boards outside. Rooms were clean and breakfast was good. Charged tax additional to the price mentioned in the booking website. We booked a triple room but it was more like a double room with extra bed. Overall it was okay. Though I would say its not worth the money. Location is pretty good as it is inside the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “A very positive colourful experience”
Reviews.Author: RomaRomer1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family (my sister and cousin) in August 2010. We loved it! We had a triple en suite room and really enjoyed our stay. We had to wait until 2pm to check into our room, although they let us leave our bags there for a couple of hours. The hostel is about 10 minutes walk from the METRO or about 5 minutes from where the No40 bus terminates. We were incredibly impressed by the breakfast in the morning. I have done a lot of travelling and staying in hostels over the last few years and I have to say that it is probably the BEST breakfast that I've had in this sort of place; cereal, toast, croissants and pastries, yoghurts, fresh fruit, juices and coffee. What better way to start your day!? The only down side to breakfast is the limited seat capacity, that the kitchen area has. Get up early to get the best seats!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly delightful!”
Reviews.Author: moony606
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights, and we weren't expecting much, since the price was so low. However, it was a wonderful surprise when we spoke witht he friendly staff and entered our lovely, clean room. The beds were comfortable, the shower was great and there were free bottles of water everyday. The street noise is loud, so bring earplugs if you have a problem sleeping. The staff were very helpful with directions and recommending places to eat. Internet is free in the lobby. The hotel is literally right next to the Vatican! Breakfast was bleh but included in the price. They put Nutella inside a chocolate croissant WEIRD. You also need to get to breakfast eraly because the seating is limited. The only downside is that the metro is not very close to the hotel. So if you have tons of luggage or are exhausted after a long day of sightseeing, getting to the hotel from the metro is agonizing. We would definitely stay here agian, bringing less luggage and splurging for a cab from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jasper707
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colors was in a fantastic location. The rooms could be very cold, but they did provide additional blankets. There is a cozy little balcony on the 3rd floor, perfect for sipping espresso and nibbling on the breakfast goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Pricey Rome, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: boscosq
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and were pretty satisfied. Comfy bed. Bright decor. Good TV. Nice ensuite bath, though "wide-bodied" people might have a squeeze into the shower stall. Of course, you carry your bags up the stairs, it is a budget hotel in an old bldg. Prati is a great "normal n-hood" -- near enough to access the Vatican and Centro Storico, but away from the touristo madness. Though the competent staff might not be the most cheery group, they always came through w/ accurate and helpful info/directions. Breakfast was fine. The coffee was not as strong as found at nearby cafes. One oddity was the steaming hot water that flushed the toilet....... We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and gorgeous ! I loved it. Bright and colorful. Great amenities. The price was amazing for everything we got. The breakfast was delicious and a great variety. Me and my three girlfriends went here and we enjoyed ever second of it ! We loved drinking coffee on the beautiful rooftop terrace! This hotel is relaxing, not for the partying type.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with good amenities - but no hostel...”
Reviews.Author: Luc C
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience with Hotel Colors. Very clean rooms, along with towels, linen, and a bright atmostphere make this palce a comfortable place to stay for a couple of days at a reasonable price...for Rome. Where my difficulty with this place comes in is when you start talking about it as a hostel. It is obvious that this Hotel has converted some of its larger (and smaller) rooms into dorm-style accomodations in order to drum up some business. This is fine, and the rooms are both bright and large enough (mostly) to accomodate this idea, but they have yet to buy into the rest of the hostel vibe, which can be difficult. There is no secure storage space in this "hostel" except for the one safe in each room, the hotel kind with the changable code. That is great if you are by yourself and you get there first, but not so good if you are together with other people or don't get it first. They also do not have luggage storage, and although they are nice enough to let you leave your luggage there, you leave it in the hall, and they do a poor job of monitoring it. The breakfast is good for the price and you can eat as much as you want, which is nice when you are an all-day walker like I am. All in all, this is a pretty good palce to stay, and in a pinch I would stay there again, but I would look for another place first I think.

Reviews.Title: “Best position,charmful room, best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Anna R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in really safe area of Rome, near to the Vatican City. You can come back late at night and you feel absolutely secure there (and the reception is open 24/24). The room was charmful- colorous, clean, with small balcony. And the breakfast is just awesome- wide range of sweet, salty and you can eat as much as you want!

Reviews.Title: “Not good / avoid”
Reviews.Author: Nicktorian
Reviews.Content: It's the norm in Rome for people in the hospitality industry to be rude and unhelpful , but the staff at hotel colours have taken being rude, unhelpful, bad mannered , crass and everything nasty to new heights. I would avoid this place like the plague . The rooms are tidy but the horrible staff really make the experience bad.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there”
Reviews.Author: AndreySergeevich
Reviews.Content: The bright pictures may attract you. Although the reality is dull. I understand that rooms are often tiny in Rome hotels, but could not imagine it can be than tiny for three people. In addition the third bad was so terribly uncomfortable. It was not a normal bad even, but kind of a folding bad. And there was absolutely not enough space for three people in our room. Although we paid for a fully-featured room for three persons! They simply put this folding ban in a room for two! The hotel's manager always lied to us and ignored all our complaints. We booked this hotel through booking.com and had a print-out stating that the stay can be cancelled for free. The booking confirmation also indicated that the nights have different price. However this print-out was so unhelpful! All the terms and conditions were not stated in an explicit form. When we tried to leave this terrible hotel the manager claimed that we cannot do so as the credit card will be charged anyway for the full duration of stay. Also the manager claimed that all nights have similar price. According to the manager we had to suffer till the end. There was nothing I liked about this hotel, but can say that the breakfast was normal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cute, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lindabelinda
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. First of all, it's CLEAN which just makes you feel good when checking into a room. Secondly, the decor if a bit Ikea-cheap is cheerful with brightly colored walls and furnishings as the name suggests. Third, the free breakfast is so good! The lady on breakfast duty will make you a freshly pulled espresso or cappuccino every morning and it is absolutely delicious (you know you're in Italy when you taste that first cup of coffee). There was a generous spread of bread, coldcuts, cheeses, pastries, fruit, yogurt, and juice. Rooms, at least the double private ones, are small but normal for Rome. The location is very close to the Vatican but also in a more residential neighborhood which I liked. Gracci, one of the best gelaterias in Rome is nearby too. The front desk was super helpful with everything and we stopped by at least three times a day for recommendations, reservations, directions, etc. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: KelAnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel our first two nights in Italy. It was a great! It's a little tricky to find but you can take a bus to Piazza Cavour for about 8 euro...and then walk about 10 more minutes to the hotel. Be aware that you will have quite a few stairs to climb up...we were on the third floor and it was a bit of a hike with our suitcases. The rooms are very small but they are complete with everything you need: air conditioning, refrigerator, wifi, tv, safe, etc The rooms and bathrooms are clean and well-kept. The breakfast is delicious and served in a cute small little room on the first floor. The first night we stayed it was a little noisey but it was fine the second night. The front-desk staff was very helpful in picking out places to eat and providing advice. The hotel is also about a ten minute walk from the vatican, which is great! Overall, if you're looking for a place that is not too expensive and is close to the vatican, that isn't very big - this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: azannie61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we left on a cruise. May 26th 2011. It was enough. Pros are it is clean, very near to Vatican, nice outdoor terrace on the 5th floor with views, it is an inexpensive price. Cons: No elevator and no one offering to bring bags to your room. Yep, its a walk-up and there is a middle floor they don't count so it your room is on 3 (like ours was), it is really on 4 which is 8 flights of steps up. This may not be a con to some people, but I tell you just as a warning. Other cons: air conditioning is non existent (doesn't work) so windows are kept open at night for air and even 4 flights up, street noise is loud and constant all night. No sleep. Maybe a room that doesn't face the street would be quieter? Something to ask. Bathroom is very small. My 6'3 husband sat side saddle so his knees wouldn't hit into the shower, which by the way is lifted 18 inches or so off the floor with a door opening too narrow for an average size woman to fit thru.A challenge to get into. Breakfast was ok, staff is not quick to replenish trays. Small eating area, but we shared a table with a very nice lady from South Africa and had an enjoyable meal. We found the first person we met at the front desk helpful and friendly. After her, the others at desk were not happy or friendly and did not have the time to even reach behind them and tear a street map off for us. I believe this hotel is best suited for younger travelers (18-30ish) traveling with friends because in my experience, the staff and hotel (hostel) are not suited to tend to or care for older couples or the average Rome tourist with their standard questions and concerns. We are a 50 year old couple and had 2 18 year old girls with us (in another room)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: HannaS2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Colors and found that it was a nice experience. They give very clear directions on how to get there from the airport and we found it quite easily. My partner and I had a private room which overlooked the street and was equipped with a mini-fridge, cable television, and toiletries. It was brightly decorated and very comfortable for the two of us. The staff all spoke English fluently and were very helpful in recommending places for us to go. One of the staff members told us about a great area full of younger people where we were able to have a great night on the town and also how to navigate it with public transit. The breakfast room is a little small, but all the guests were friendly. So as long as you don't mind sharing a table, there was ample seating and the food selection was wonderful. I was easily able to eat a large breakfast to prepare me for a long day of traveling. We would recommend this place to any younger couples or groups traveling together!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to decide if it's a hotel or a hostel”
Reviews.Author: NomadicKiwi1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on a recent holiday in Italy for a few nights. The plus sides of this place are the location near the Vatican, the outdoor seating area which is a nice place for a meal and bottle of wine overlooking the rooftops in the evening, the staff were generally friendly and helpful (apart from one lady who decided it was necessary to reprimand us for leaving our key at reception when there was no-one there, a slight over-reaction on her part) the breakfast selection is good and there's free internet on the 3rd floor!! (first time we've come across this on our travels) The cons are it can't decide whether its a hotel or a hostel, so you have dorm beds and doubles on the same floor which provides a kind of conflict when young immature travelers staying in the dorms arrive home at 2 in the morning drunk and noisy therefore waking up the occupants of the double rooms who have paid hotel prices in the hopes of a good nights sleep. The other downside is the air con doesn't work (could have been too early in the year) so it was actually preferable for us to leave the window open at night and deal with the street noise as opposed to dealing with the noise in the hallway. There also wasn't enough space for everyone to sit and have breakfast, so there were frequently queues of people waiting to be seated which wasn't ideal. Aside from this it was a decent place to stay in Rome, especially if you're only paying the hostel / dorm prices for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, friendly place, amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: Flyngel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Colors does exactly what it says on the tin: bright, welcoming decor, inexpensive rooms, shared bathroom (in all but one or two rooms). The rooms (and said shared bathroom) were pristine. My husband and I are in our 40s so we really couldn't have countenanced sharing a grotty shower! Needn't have worried: it was newly fitted and sparkling. The handbasin in our room was in similar, excellent condition. Our room (a double) was - again - clean and comfortable. Loved the traditional shutters. We were on the penultimate floor and there isn't a lift, but we were in Rome to walk so that didn't bother us at all. The weekend we were there, there was a family and one or two couples/ groups in the other rooms on that floor and we never heard a peep out of them. Via Boezio is very quiet at night, too, so no traffic to keep us awake. I'm sure you could be unlucky with revellers, but I've had that experience at 5* hotels...and it's unlikely you'll find many rugby outings here. We didn't opt to stay for breakfast, so can't comment - but we were on a mission to have coffee at as many different venues as possible: why limit ourselves to one? It's part of the fun of being in Rome. Staff are very friendly, multilingual and knowledgeable about the area. And speaking of area, you can not beat this location; 5 minutes from Castel Sant'Angelo and about 10 from Piazza Navona, super close to the Vatican and on the right side of the river for Trastevere. To sum up: it's basic, but very comfortable and convenient for the price. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities; rooms furnished by Ikea”
Reviews.Author: evajeisa
Reviews.Content: The rooms and accommodations at Hotel Colors are true to the photos and website. Once you get past the stairs, it is bright, colorful, and quite comfortable. Rooms furnished by Ikea, with refrigerator, satellite TV, a small table and chairs. The hotel offers a great breakfast spread and free internet service (which can be a little cranky at times). Service at the hotel was adequate -- not overly friendly, but not obnoxiously rude. My only complaint is receiving a telephone call at 10pm on the last night (we had to get up very early to catch a train) to see when we were checking out. ?? It appeared that the staff did not communicate well between themselves, since we had conveyed that information to someone already and paid our bill, but nevertheless, it was a very pleasant stay overall. Great neighborhood, easy access to the metro. Overall, very pleasant accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel nearby the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: toshirules
Reviews.Content: Our stay of 3 nights was good, not outragious, but for the money very acceptable. The Hotel is located in a quit street, within 5 minute walk to the Vatican. We stayed at the 3th floor, only steps: no elevator. We've booked a 3-person room, and had a normal bed for 2 persons and an extra foldaway bed. That was a little dissapointing because it doesn't sleep as well as a normal bed. Thereby the cushions were very thin and not that confortable. The room was very clean and had everything we needed: like a refrigerator and a save deposit box. On the second day the water was cold, so we went to the frontofficedesk and we've been told to wait because the hotel was fully loaded and run out of hot water. We've waited for 1,5 hours, but it didn't work, so we couldn't take a shower. Somebody else told us the boiler was on the balcony of an other room and they couldn't fix it because the guests were in the room. Okay but why didn't they tell us before, because then we wouldn't wait for the water turning warm again? The breakfast is very good.: you can choose between different kinds of bread, fruit, cornflakes, yoghurt, croissants. But be early otherwise it's possible you have all the leftovers. The room where the breakfast is served is very small, so you have to wait in line to grab a bite. Anyway Rome is a great and beautifull city, I would recommend this citytrip to everybody. And if you have a two-person room and no problems with hot water, then the stay here can be perfect. But next time when I'll visit Rome with my boyfriend I will pay a little bit more to have an excellent stay somewher else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: MagicJuan01
Reviews.Content: I wasnt sure what to expect of a European hodel, but if this is any indication, they must not be as bad as I heard. This place was clean and easy to find. No sign outside, but it was right where the google map said it was. Id come back to this place if I return to rome, tho I dont know if Im gonna do that.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cocourfull, good for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: sofaki_le
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, with 24h reception and bright and colourfull rooms! Good location, near vatican and near metro station. friendly staff and great breakfast included!!! free internet connection too! very good place for backpackers!!! theres no elevator, and that may be a problem if you hava a lot of luggages and you stay at the third floor...soundproofing is not good and you can hear the others talking or walking... small breakfast room, you have to wait to empty a table...

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Brian1244
Reviews.Content: We are a middle-aged Canadian couple who prefer to stay at safe, clean, modestly priced and well-located accommodations. Colors Hotel is a good place to stay. The staff is both friendly and helpful. The room and attached bathroom are both clean and functional. The breakfast is modest but acceptable. There was air conditioning in our room. The hotel has internet computers available and the hotel was happy to print tickets we purchased online. Both the subway and bus stops are a few blocks away. The Vatican is conveniently nearby. We recommend this place and would definitely stay again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the stay and recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSilva
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in colors hotel with friends and we liked Hotel Colors because it was friendly, the staff was nice and helped us whenever we needed to, also gaved us informations and tips :) The rooms were clean, brightfull, and the bathroom was cool and every day the cleaner changed the towels and left amenities like showercap or soap..I was also nice to have a minibar in the room. The breakfast was continental, but cool, but the breakfast room was small and sometimes we had to wait for table... bur it was ok... The same room had computer with free internet acess...nice :) Also the location was excelent, in a safe and quiet zone, and near a big comercial avenue, Av. Cola di Renzio with shops, cafes, restaurants and supermarket... Is was also near Vatican, only 5, to 10 min walk, and near the center, we visit most of the city by walk and return to the hotel always walking, so it was very well located! The only thing that I didn't liked about Hotel Colors was the fact that the hotel dind't have an elevator, so we had to climb the stairs up to the 3rd floor with big cases... But my opinion ot that Colors Hotel is value for money and i recommend not only for young people, but also for families and mature travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy, small room”
Reviews.Author: brennama
Reviews.Content: The location of this "hostel" is fantastic - very easy to walk to Vatican, St. Peter's, walk across the river into the city center or hop on the metro. We really really liked this location. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and pretty. The breakfast is fantastic and we did not have to wait for a table - but it is a small room indeed. Our personal room, however, lead much to be desired. We were on the ground floor on the side of a major street which meant tons of street noise all nigh even with the windows closed. We also got a ton of noise from the reception area with the voices of the staff and visitors echoing down the hall .The room was tiny (although built in shower was very nice) with very little room for personal items. I think our main complaint was the noise. If I were to come back to this hotel I would request to be on an upper floor and on the side away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Christymarie610
Reviews.Content: This would have been a great stay except for a few things. The room we had was clean and had a bathroom but both nights I ran out of hot water. The last thing you want after walking around Rome all day is a cold shower. The thing that made me the most mad was that we were told each day we would have bottles of water in the room, when they weren't there I just went to the reception to ask for them nicely. The guy at the front desk was rude and told me I had to pay but I told him it was included in the room, then he got on the phone with someone speaking in Italian. He finally gave me the bottles of water but told me I would have to pay next time, pissed me off. I didn't have a problem paying but if it's included then it's included. The other thing was that the breakfast was a waste, not much and the room was very small and crowded. I thought it was a youth hostel so it was kind of annoying to see a bunch of old people taking there sweet time while people stood. I ended up eating abowl of cereal in the hallway. It's close to Vatican and clean but wouldn't stay here again. Also there is wifi but signal is weak.

Reviews.Title: “It's a scam”
Reviews.Author: orangesunset_10
Reviews.Content: We never got to actually stay at this hotel. In April 2010 our 3 night booking was confirmed for 59 Euros a night. In August 2010 (4 months after confirmation and 2 weeks prior to our stay) the hotel emailed us twice to let us know that the 59 euro price agreed on was a mistake on THEIR website and the actual price was now 85 euros (the second email stated 95 euros a night???). We contacted the Europian Consumer centre and were told this is not something that can be done under Italian law. Needless to say we we did not trust this hotel and did not give them a chance to say they no longer had our booking once we turned up!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable stay near the Vatican but lack of Security for belongings.”
Reviews.Author: anaccidentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: Colors was a nice place to stay. It is in a residential area near the Vatican so it's quiet at night and peaceful. The rooms are very appealing and clean and I got a good night's sleep. My only criticism is that there was a lack of security for personal belongings. I was in a 5 person dorm room and there were no lockers for our backpacks so you have to trust the people you are staying with (usually strangers). On top of that, we could only borrow the key to our room to open the door and had to leave them at the front desk when going out and we were told to leave the room unlocked when we left (with all of our stuff in it). Basically, your stuff is vulnerable. On this trip, I had great people sharing my room so there were no worries, but I can imagine that is not always the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: clawillets
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very good spotless rooms, bathrooms and great breakfest!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple hostel accommodation”
Reviews.Author: uktj
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel seems to have a mixture of hotel-style and hostel-style (dorm) accommodation so watch out. It's located on a quiet side street close to the Vatican, near to a metro station but is a little outside the "main" centre - so, reasonably convenient but you might do a little more walking than somewhere more central. My booking got messed up somewhere between the Colors Hotel and the agency website I booked with (not sure whose fault) which meant that I got turned away on the first night of two, which was annoying although they had at least booked me a room elsewhere, albeit on the other side of town. (They hadn't e-mailed me to warn me of a problem; they said they'd called and I did have a single missed call without a number earlier in the week, so they could have tried harder). The hotel is decorated nice and brightly as the name suggests. Both the reception staff I spoke to were really nice and friendly. I stayed in a 5-bed dorm which was clean and comfortable with a mixture of normal and bunk beds, with a small but clean ensuite bathroom. No breakfast offered to me, but there are plenty of places around to grab something quick. I didn't really use any facilities other than the room, but got a decent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good for city exploration”
Reviews.Author: CL1982Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated literally 5 mins from the Vatican and it's really worth the walk in the evening, when there are less tourists around and the fountains are lit up. The hotel itself doesn't look like much from the outside, but the rooms are very clean and of a decent size. Unfortunately, being more or less in the city centre, the traffic noise is quite considerable but if you're only staying for a couple of nights it's bearable. We had a room right next to reception on the ground floor. This and the noise was one of the reasons why we couldn't open our windows - a shame. I gather the rooms are varied but ours had only a shower (not a bathroom) and the toilet was across the hall. It was ok, as I said, for 2 nights. The rooms were clean and they even provided toiletries which I wasn't expecting, as it's more of a hostel-type place. The breakfast was excellent but it got quite crowded in the little room where they served it. However, there is the tiniest little balcony which can be accessed from this room and we spent a few hours there every evening, playing cards and enjoying the relative quiet. I really missed the chance to have a cup of tea 'out of hours' as there were no such facilities available. Internet was available with a code from reception and was also provided in the above-mentioned breakfast room. The only thing that I really didn't like about the hotel were the staff. They all had an unpleasant attitude to customers and it struck me as a burden to them that I was staying there. All in all, I don't think I would go back there personally, but I think it's ok for what it is - a budget-smack-bang-in-the-middle-of-Rome-exploration-base!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelTogether
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a four day trip to Rome, and would highly recommend the Colors Hotel for any travellers wanting somewhere clean, friendly and comfortable to stay in Rome. Caters for everyone from backpackers to families with young children - we're a couple so had a double room with private shower which was great - always hot water, powerful shower, clean room, REALLY comfy beds, free wi-fi, towels etc -all you need. The location was perfect - five mins walk from the Vatican but no tourist hustle and bustle, a really nice quiet neighbourhood. The girls on reception were SO helpful, always someone on recption night and day. Great free breakfast included in the price (wouldn't hurt for the lady in the breakfast room to crack a smile sometimes!!). Would definitely stay here again, try it for yourself. Agree about lots of stairs - harder work in the evening after a long day of walking the city!

Reviews.Title: “Simply familiar feeling, nice people, nice guests, mostly foreigners.”
Reviews.Author: Seanquazzo
Reviews.Content: Simply familiar feeling, nice people, nice guests, mostly foreigners. I stayed there for 2 nights with Alberto (11 yrs old), and I appreciated. We came from Milan, Italy. I truly recommend to people who do not have particular need and want to save money in a very expensive city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/price for location”
Reviews.Author: ayew
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and would recommend if you are on a budget. Bus stop was close by for only 1 euro. Very clean as newly renovated. Stayed on 3rd floor with balcony just outside our window which was quiet. Do not recommend if you can't do steps as there is no elevator. Continental breakfast was included, free access to internet, but no lockers. Staff spoke English and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiveing”
Reviews.Author: griffith1
Reviews.Content: Colors was one of the worst experiences that I'er ever had at a hotel. The first night was fine, despite the noise from nearby rooms. We expected Rome to be noisy buy not with noise pollution coming from adjourning rooms at 6am on a Thursday morning. It resembled a circus. Calling them paper thin walls would be a vast understatement. On top of that, the staff was on or off. Some of the attendants were friendly and helpful and others were cantankerous and useless. If you stay here, don't expect to come home later than 12am because you might have problems getting in (sleeping and uninformed attendants). We waited more than 20 minutes just to get in. It was a mess! I wouldn't recommend this place to a dog let alone one of my fiends. Next time in Rome, I will undoubtedly look elsewhere. Colors looks like a great place, but looks can be deceiving .

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hostel”
Reviews.Author: catzenjammer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 days in Rome and, as we wanted to keep our budget low, we decided to try a hostel. Now, we've been to many hostels in Europe, and some were pretty horrible. Therefore we were rather apprehensive. We had decided, however, that as long as it was clean and we could feel like sleeping in the room, we'd stay. Hotel Colors turned out to be simple, but comfortable, clean and really good value for the €75 we paid per night. In fact, we had several pleasant surprises, when we reached the hotel. To begin with, we discovered that the low-budget buss from the airport stops at Piazza Cavour, only a few blocks away from the hostel. Then, although our guide of Rome had told us otherwise, we discovered breakfast was included. It wasn't the best we have ever had, but it was decent enough: coffee, tea, fruits, a large selection of juices, a selection of corns, cakes and bread, as well as cornflakes etc. were served every morning between 8 and 10am. Also, we had no idea that we would be able to go on-line, but here was a free Internet access. One could either connect one's PC or mobile-phone to a network, or use the computer in the breakfast room. Finally, to our astonishment, we discovered that our room was brand-new. We were the first to use it after it had been redecorated and the bathroom constructed. We even had a nice balcony. Needless to say our newly refurbished room was spotless when we arrived. In addition, the room was cleaned every day. In terms of location, Hotel Colors is not in the city center, however, it lies between Castel San Angelo and the Vatican, in a quiet street. Distances in Rome aren't that great: it took us 15mins to walk to Piazza Navona and 10mins to the Vatican. There is plenty of public transport nearby: from Piazza Cavour, via Cicerone and the Vatican. Metro A also stops some 10mins away. On Via Cola di Rienzo, you will find plenty of shops and there are many ristorante and trattoria for your evening meals nearby. The staff was nice and polite, and all of them spoke English. If you just need a clean and quiet place to sleep while you wander around Rome's monuments and don't expect luxuries, Hotel Colors is the perfect choice! (One note, though, for those who require a lift, you may not like this hostel, as there are only stairs. It didn't bother us).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and superb location”
Reviews.Author: CatchingCathedrals
Reviews.Content: This hostel is minutes from the Vatican. There are beautiful balconies on each floor. An exquisite breakfast is served every morning for a small price. My experience here was nothing but good!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bojooth
Reviews.Content: I got a room with a shower (but no toilet) for a great rate. It can be loud in this hostel (it is more a hostel than a hotel) and all the amenities are pretty basic. Free internet was about the best thing but even that only worked sporadically. The breakfast was OK but you had to get in early to just get a seat and get the good stuff. The staff were not overly helpful but not rude. I think the location is what lets this place down. If you want to spend all your time at the Vatican then its great otherwise it is a pain to set out from and get back to each day/night. It was a good/safe neighbourhood so there wasn't any worries there but it is so far away from most sites that it was tiring just getting back and forth each day. If money is an issue and your needs are fairly basic then this place may impress. Otherwise you might want to spend a bit more and get in closer to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced overrated with dorm bed age restriction 40! is that even legal!”
Reviews.Author: caroline50London
Reviews.Content: I had booked a dorm bed for three nights. When I arrived I was told I was too old at 51 as there was an age restriction of 40 on dorm accommodation. I was offered a single room at a reduced rate but this still increased my costs by 75 euros. I was also liable for the first nights stay since I had not given 48 hrs notice! Feeling I was in a no win situation I stayed. Returning home I again scanned the website for the information concerning dorm accommodation age restriction and can find nothing! It is on the email conformation but you only get that after booking! The kitchens are small but nice but would struggle to cope with full occupation. The kitchen and terrace are the only communal areas and locked at 10 pm so its a pretty dismal in your room evening. The internet did not work. A poor hostel experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place knowingly ripped us off and is overrated”
Reviews.Author: Fiona20
Reviews.Content: Location was good. We were paying 27 euro each per night in a dorm while other people in our room were paying 20. The owner didnt care and just said that was what we had agreed to. Was pretty annoyed by this as we purposefully booked on their website to reduced comission from hostelworld. Doesnt seem like much but over 4 nights was more than 50 euro more. I would suggest to others not to agree to more than 20. Other than that the kitchen is good...and they provide jam and cornflakes. we assumed that meant bread and milk too but not to be! Plus the "free" internet didnt work the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little hostal - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: iamsoatomic
Reviews.Content: Great little space. Perfectly located 5 minutes from Saint Peter's Square. Not the usual hostal (noisy, crowded, dirty). Clean, big and colourful rooms (we even had a sink and shower in the room, although booked with shared bathroom). Huuuuuge and yummy breakfast. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great service, all ruined by one staff member”
Reviews.Author: YSAKURAI1
Reviews.Content: Great location! Only a few minutes away from the Vatican and just a bit more to all of the other attractions. I was able to get a (looked newly renovated) single room for 50 Euro/Night. The regular staff was friendly and helpful. Just don't expect any "hotel class service" from them. Its more of a hostel with nice single rooms. Just one piece of advice. Watch out for a person called Zaman (I think he's Indian). He's either the manager/owner of the place, or just someone with a huge attitude. He apparently does not know the words "please " and "thank you" exist in the English language. One of most bitter people I've ever met. If you want customer UNservice go to him. Location and accomodations, would recommend this place. However, that ONLY IF Zaman isn't around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, central to lots of stuff-stay here”
Reviews.Author: HuBison
Reviews.Content: Well, I will start with the good stuff. You can walk to the Vatican and to the Castle di St. Angelo. If you don't have a lot of luggage, once you come in from the Central Termini train station or airport, you can take the metro near the hotel. It's on a quiet corner, the staff is helpful (except the one who didn't speak much English), breakfast is included, and there is a desktop in the hallway in case you have to get online! Now, the not so good news: I think my cot had bed bugs cause I was scratching and itching like a little doggie, but that doesn't mean everyroom is like that. They hold your luggage for you if you get there early or are leaving late. They have a great map of the city, can direct you to the supermarket or pharmacy, and the showerswas clean. It was recommended to me by someone who has stayed here several times, and I'm passing along the recommendation as long as you sleep on top several layers or bring your own sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Really Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: stereogirl
Reviews.Content: I spent my first night in Rome at Hotel Colors. I had a little bit of a crisis because my bank had canceled my credit card because I forgot to call them before I took off and was freaking out and not being myself because I was tired. The sweet girl at the reception area was really understanding and helped me out. I was able to check in and take a nap and settled everything after a few hours. The shared hostel room was really comfortable and I met some really nice young travelers. Then at sunset, I walked to the river and watched the sun go down and then returned and had some wine on the terrace. It is in what is maybe the best part of town to stay in because it is very close to the quintessential old Roman neighborhoods across the river, but conveniently close to the Vatican. There are also private rooms which I assume are just as nice as the shared rooms. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Scary at First....”
Reviews.Author: JaninaOne
Reviews.Content: To be honest this place was a little scary at first. It was my first time in Rome and my sister and I did not arrive until late at night. Once at the wall with a heavy wooden door in it we rang the buzzard a few times not realizing that is was really heavy. (still after a few rings you would think someone would come to the door). We had a sink and shower and had to share the bathroom. At first I did not think I would be able to cope, but after the second day it wasn't that bad. You have to take advantage of the free computer in the hall, and the "continental" breakfast- it makes up for the service(it's not completely bad but it is a little rough). We stayed at the hostel for 3 days, and overall I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The location was good and that was about it...”
Reviews.Author: infogirl09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colors was by far the most disorganized hostel I stayed at anywhere between England and Greece. Making a reservation was pointless as the reception gave away our beds AFTER we had already checked in. When we returned that evening there were bags on our bed and we had an in denial receptionist who refused to acknowledge that there was any mistake. A whole series of shuffling beds took place and at the end of it all the last girl to arrive was sent out onto the streets of Rome in the middle of the night. The location was good and that was about it because there was no organization, no money to give change (and they only take cash - can you smell a scam?), and absolutely no customer service. Unfortunately, after my experience I would not recommend this hostel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for vatican visit”
Reviews.Author: jhakimmd
Reviews.Content: located near the vatican, st. peters, and the castel of angles, you find this hotel on a back street. They call it a bead and breakfast, but the breakfast is a croissant and a kitchen you can use yourself. the beds are very basic but functional and quite. it works but is not luxury in any way. it provides a safe, clean and convienet place to stay in a very expensive city. the free interenet acess was a plus. They have someone at the front desk at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LemonadeJoe
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty much no frills (no TV, no decorations) but spacious and comfortable. Great for the Vatican but not too bad for some other sights (the Spanish Steps etc.; too far from the Ancient Rome sights like the Coloseum, though). Quiet. They made an extremely informative and at times brilliantly funny brochure on Rome for hotel guests which they leave for you in the room. Other than that the service was quite no frills as well. Compared to other hotels close to the centre this was really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If your plan is to see vatican area, couldnt find a better place”
Reviews.Author: LBogie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel colors with a friend of mine when we went to rome to see vatican city and museums and the borghese gallery and villa. The Hotel (hostel really) is suberb compared to other hostels ive stayed at, out room was huge, and had three beds but we only got charged at the twin bed rate. We had our own shower, which didnt have a curtain and was therefore not really helpful as my friend and i are not quite "that" close lol but the common bathrooms were excellent at the end of the hall, there were three individual doors that led to its own toilet and shower, so it was not a terrible comunal setting. the desk people were very helpful to us, and the room was cleaned every day, the area was very quiet and a mere 5ish minute walk to vatican city, a bit far of a walk to borghese. if you arrive at termini you just have to take a bus to st. peters and you are very very near the hostel. the best way to find it is to use google maps to plot the hostel on a map and also to plot other landmarks in the area, that way you can always find it, as it is on a small unpopulated side street and has just a small sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSussex
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay at Hotel Colors, location was fantastic, only trouble was not a very big sign outside saying where it was, completely walked past it, and carried on to the end of the road. Whoops. Arrived before check in time, and the room was ready, which was great considering we'd been up since 4.30am. We stayed in a private room with our own facilities. Room was clean, except for a few stains on the bed cover, from what looked like someone having a nice 'romantic time' in the room! To our suprise the room was made up by housekeeping everyday, even folding my clothes and putting them under the pillow. Maybe this is normal, but i've never stayed in a hostel before. Room wasn't too noisy, except for the internet access being in the same corridor, and you could actually hear the tap-tapping of the keyboard, and people talking. We didn't experience the breakfast, as we had early starts and decided to get something outside. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Vatican, and about an hours walk to the Colesseum, which luckily enough for us the weather was perfect. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the Metro line (except on the way where it was about 30 minutes!) All in all, a very pleasant stay, and would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck near Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Redworm
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! Close to the Vatican and easy to access from the Metro, this hotel is a great value. It is a 15-20 minute walk down to the historical center through a fantastic part of the city. We stayed on the floor with no "dorm" rooms. It was simple, quiet and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were the best as far as Italian breakfasts go (think meat and cheese). Our room was very comfortable and quite, we couldn't have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Combo Hotel/Hostel Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: santarosapaul
Reviews.Content: Great budget boutique hostel/hotel in the central part of Rome with easy access to sites. I stayed in a single, private with shower and it was roomy, clean, and budget-friendly. Staff was friendly and always on duty. Spoke perfect English. The included breakfast was perfect - cereal, coffee, breads, juices, yogurt and some sandwich meats. The only con is that the hotel is in a nice, old building, tight spaces so one can hear traffic in hallways. Overall - a very good value and selection.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, great breakfast, decent location”
Reviews.Author: DavidS13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Colors for 4 nights, we enjoyed it very much. Location is pretty good, close to Vatican City and not too far from the Rome metro. Close also to a major commercial street, with a grocery store and other shopping and restaurants. Staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was very good - be sure to get a free cappucino. Too many mosquitos in the room though... Hotel also has kitchens which are available to the guests, that was a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: AllisonSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel/hostel is cheap and clean. Our room had a private shower, but a shared bathroom. A decent location, very close to The Vatican. I think there are other areas of Rome that are more enjoyable, but this place is great if you are looking for something cheap. Breakfast not included. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: emmaline
Reviews.Content: Stay in the hotel with 2 friends. Had a good stay. The rooms are clean and everything in the place was white! Ironic! The rooms were large enough and the staff was welcoming and helpful. We booked tours for Enjoy Rome ( Vatican and Ancient Rome Night Tour) through the hotel staff. These tours were first rate and I plan to take them when I'm in Rome again this summer. The breakfast was pathetic and the bathrooms were shared. They were clean, but the bathtub/shower was really high to get in to and I ended up bumping my knee rather badly getting out. Overall, I would recommend it for students backpacking around Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great for students”
Reviews.Author: jgoldste
Reviews.Content: For 20 euro a night, Colors was clean, quiet, easy to find, very near the Vatican (a major site and easily located on a map- not to be underrated!)- in other words, everything you need if you just need a place to spend the night. I booked a dorm bed in a room with three beds and a sink, with a bathroom down the hall. The room was right on the street and could have been noisy if there had been people out, but the area was quiet- pretty residential, despite being only a few blocks from the Vatican. Only qualm is that when I wanted to use the Internet at night, reception (where 2 euro buys you an hour of internet time on their 2 computers) was closed. So get your internet code in advance, and don't forget to bring a towel, but I can highly recommend Hotel Colors for anyone (aged 18-35, their rule) who just needs a hot shower and a warm clean bed to complement their Roman adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Colors - Great budget option”
Reviews.Author: Dublinmissy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome during peak season and booked last minute. It was a toss up between a cheap hotel or a hostel and I am glad I picked colors. We had booked a nice bright room with a shower but shared toilet. The staff were lovely and helpful and the courtyard area was particulary nice. The whole place was spotlessly clean. The location is fine. It's close to the vatican but a little further away from other attractions. We ended getting alot of taxis because your feet tend to kill you when your walking around Rome all day. I think you could probably walk everywhere though. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really a fantastic option”
Reviews.Author: GalwayMike
Reviews.Content: Colors is a fabulous budget option in Rome. For 2 people in a twin room with an ensuite shower and a shared bathroom the total was $75/night. I guarantee you won't find a better option in Rome for a similar price. The rooms and shared bathrooms are immaculately clean. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to Ottaviano metro station, which is probably your best route to the historical center. And it's about a 10 minute walk to the Vatican museums and St. Peter's. The staff is fluently bilingual (English, Italian) and was a great help for anything and everything including making restaurant reservations. Furthermore, the hotel is related to the Enjoy Rome (check out their website for more) travel operation, so they're loaded up with tour options that you can take including ones out of town to the Appian Way and catacombs. All told, there's nothing fancy here, but it's a great, clean, solid hotel with a great staff for an unbeatable price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hostel”
Reviews.Author: rmw230
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, attractive, great location, friendly, best dorm room I've stayed in, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hannahck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel colors for 4 nights in August, in a private room with ensuite. When we arrived we were suprised to be told that our nightly rate had been reduced due to a quieter time. The room was very nice and excellent air-conditioning. The breakfast was simple but fine. The staff were very helpful and booked tours for us. The location is great, in a very nice, safe area near the vatican. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: chavi
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel in Rome last summer. It was really hot but we had A/C in our room.... The place is really nice and very close to the center (especially the Vatican) and shopping areas. The room was very clean, and the staff really helpful: they helped us with museums hours and they even booked us a visit at the Borghese gallery...the only problem was that it didn't have the elevator...but they got our luggages for us.

Reviews.Title: “Will do...”
Reviews.Author: piccolita
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed at Colors only for a night , since my sibs and I arrived Rome a day earlier than planned so we just really had to work with the options in the book we were holding. It wasn't a bad place to stay at all. The reason I give this a three circle rating is that, we were able to get a similar standard hostel for less. We paid more than 100 euros for a triple room. While this isnt too much, we were able to get a bit less on a place located near Piazza Barberini which is much quieter, and on the same level of cleanliness. Good points: location which is near the Vatican area, triple room was spacious. Affordable price. Colors is an ok place to stay if you are single and very young- like 18-25 or maybe a bit older, and you really aim to socialize with other travellers but if yu treasure your personal space, you'll only get it inside your room. I am single and not much much older, but I found that there is too much going on here. Too many people with a limited amount of space is a bit overwhelming. Hallways are not very wide, with a computer posted outside. This means that at any given time, there will be somebody there using the computer. Our room was sort of on street level, if not slightly elevated, and we could hear street noise even with windows closed. I do not mind having to share bathrooms as long as it is clean. Well, when i initially checked out bathroom, it was ok and looked clean, however it the shower area was small, even if im svelte (-yah right!) and Asian. You'd have to bend your knees if you dropped your soap or something. And eeeew, somebody left his briefs, and i just had to ignore and not get grossed out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Loud”
Reviews.Author: Travlin_boy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colors is a nice and clean hotel. It's located about a 10 minute walk from the Vatican and the nearest subway stop. The room is clean and basic, however for 75 Euros, or about $100/night, I would expect something maybe with a toilet. My room came with a shower and sink. Also, being right on the street, the room is VERY loud! Rome traffic is non-stop, so try to get a room facing the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid option”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanCowgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a private room with our own en suite bathroom for 130 euro's in high season. The room was neither small nor big but it was clean. There's nothing exceedingly special about this hotel, but there's absolutely nothing wrong with it either. If you are looking for a romantic, ivy covered, authentic italian hotel, this is not it. However, you tend to spend a minimum of time in the hotel, and I'd rather spend our money on shopping, wine and food. It was nice to have english speaking staff too. The location is excellent. Not touristy, but not in the midle of nowhere either. Close to all the sights by either foot or the nearby metro. The only area difficult to get to is Trastavere, but we did walk there in about 45 minutes and cabbing is always an option. There are some great restaurants (Raf is close, good and dependable) and some great shopping. Overall, I would recommend this hotel because it was a good price, clean, private bathroom and great location. If you are willing to spend about 200 euros a night, you would likely get something better, but if price is important to you then Hotel Colors is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent!”
Reviews.Author: EKkj
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean, friendly hotel. A place that makes you feel that you are staying in your own room, thanks to the discreet (almost invisible) personnel. Within walking distance to almost all monuments and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Colors!”
Reviews.Author: Stew_H
Reviews.Content: Looking for convenient and affordable accommodation in Rome? Then look no further than Colors! We've stayed here on several occasions now and the experience gets better with each visit. On arrival, you'll be presented with a handy guidebook to the city and surroundings containing exactly the kind of unbiased information that you need when exploring a city for the first time. The location is superb: a 5 minute walk from the Vatican and 15 mins from the Centro Storico (by foot). What's more, you're only a couple of blocks from a no.40 bus stop, which connects with Termini station, passing most of the major Roman attractions en route. The nearest metro isn’t far away either. The staff (who all speak excellent English) have a real desire to make your stay a happy one and have ensured that we return at least once a year to reacquaint ourselves with this wonderful city. Colors provides dorm and private accommodation (both with air-conditioning), costing from around 20euros per person per night. This is a little more than some of the hostels around termini but anybody who has stayed at Colors will agree that it’s well worth the extra for location and service. There is a kitchen available for guests to use with complimentary tea and coffee and cornflakes are provided for breakfast. For those who like to be self-sufficient whilst on holiday, one of the biggest and best supermarkets in Rome is just across the road. Back in the hotel, there is a roof garden/terrace where you can enjoy your dinner or a glass of wine on a warm summer evening. All in all, if it’s comfort, value, service and location you’re after (and let’s face it, who’s not?!), then I strongly recommend you give colors a go. We’ll certainly be heading back!

Reviews.Title: “More hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrgnk
Reviews.Content: Room is cramped, the bathroom even more so. The room is so small opening the bag occupies most off it, and it doesn't even have a cupboard, just a space to hang your shirts. And the bathroom has no pegs, no towel rack. The breakfast is basic, and the bread is pretty lousy. The rooms are up on the 3rd floor with no lift. And they don't take credit cards and they want you to be at least a day ahead on the payments. But it's not all bad. The positives : The room is clean, the air conditioning really works ( and it was very very hot when we were there ). There is also s small fridge in the room.The location is convenient, very close to the vatican. And the staff are quite knowledgable and very helpful, they even arranged breakfast for us early since we had an earlyish train. The whole atmosphere is more hostel than hotel, but the charges are more hotel than hostel. Maybe if you were cooking in their well equiped kitchen, then it might work out, but I would look for another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerIre
Reviews.Content: Really not the best. room was basic, noisy at night, shower in the corner of room, communal toilets, no lift, expensive internet facility. this is not a hotel it is a hostel. if it were to charge hostel prices it wouldnt be too bad. ok location, not very easy to find after a hot and stressful trip from the train station look for something better is my advise

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend Colors”
Reviews.Author: Reponse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is colourful, simple but well organized, clean and welcoming. Staff are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Rooms are nice and spacious. Best and convenient way to reach the hotel is to take the #40 Bus from Termini Station. It would be most helpful to tourists if the hotel could post the bus directions on their website as alternative means of transportation because the Metro is crowded and cumbersome especially if you have large or lots of luggage. Also, the walking distance from the train station to the hotel is longer. Excellent location and within walking distance to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days in Colors this May and I must say that it is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed in! The place has an amazing atmosphere and a lovely terrace to cool down after a long day of sight seeing!! Its well located, a step away from the vatican and close to the metroline. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very reasonably priced! A perfect place to stay if you're travelling alone as I was! My best to all you guys at Colors! Will definetely return!

Reviews.Title: “Check when the sheets were last washed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Initially, I thought the hotel itself was great. I stayed there a total of 3 nights. However, I was disturbed to discover that I had flea bites all over me as a result of sleeping in one of their beds. The hotel overall seemed really clean and the staff was incredibly accomodating. For the price, you can't find a better location/staff/ambience. Just make sure you get fresh sheets! I hope this was a fluke.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel colors for a complete week im March 2006. I'm a German girl and I was travelling on my own, and I was very pleased with hotel colors. It's a beautiful place, colourful and very clean. The staff is very friendly and always trying to help and to answer all sorts of questions. The atmosphere in the hotel is great, you meet all sorts of different people, guests from all over the world. Everyone I met there was very open and friendly. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Colourful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Colors Hotel as the place to stay when you are in Rome. Away from the hustle and bustle of the Termini area, this hostel/hotel is well located and has excellent facilities. Great location near the Vatican and also some nice local shops and restaurants which are not at all touristy. Definitely not a party hostel. Everything is clean and nice. A minor down side would be the noise from the streets during the day however noise levels are manageable with the windows shut. A definite plus point is the air conditioning in the hostel rooms. The staff have excellent knowledge and are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Colors was great.”
Reviews.Author: Lumsden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Colors for a full week just this end of May and loved it. We had a double room with our own bathroom which worked well. They have a mixed bag of rooms to stay in including two or three dorm style rooms. They are expanding to another floor as well. A kitchen on each floor so you can prepare your own meals if you wish. Best of all the location was fabulous. blocks from the Vatican one way. An easy walk to Centro the other. Easy access to the Metro and major bus lines. A very quiet neighbourhood unlike right Downtown. All ages staying there and pretty quiet for the most part. For the price I'd absolutely recommend it. Only note is they don't have a sign on the hotel so keep you're eyes on the addresses when your looking for it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean hostel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a double-room for three nights in July 2004. There was a watersink in the room, but no air-condition - so quite warm at nights. The shared bathroom is very clean - I saw the cleaning lady at least twice a day - and it always smelt and felt very clean there. The crowded common kitchen is ok for budget travellers. The highlight of the hostel is the roof-terrace/garden terrace where everyone had a glass of wine/beer at nights - talking and exchanged experiences. The location is good, a charming 10 minute walk at night past local winebars "enoteca", the amazing Castel Angelo, the angel-bridge, Vatican - and close to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Christams in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few weeks over Christmas. The staff was excellent and the location was awesome! Clean kitchen and bathroom, what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an great time in Rome and we stayed at Colors for 10 days. The place was clean and its location is perfect (Via Boezio, near San Peter's). The staff and management were very nice as well. I definitely recommend someone to stay at Colors in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Colors
HotelInfo.Address: Via Boezio 31, 00192 Rome, Italy
